title: Soldier, 35, is bound and shot dead in his Tennessee home months after returning from deployment
text:
Police in Tennessee are urgently on the hunt for the killer who bound and shot dead a soldier who had returned to the US in May following his year-long deployment in Poland.

Jacob Dean Bishop, 35, was discovered 'unconscious and unresponsive' by his mother at his home before 7.43am on October 1, and once patrol deputies arrived on scene it was quickly determined that foul play was involved.

On Tuesday law enforcement said witnesses described a suspicious white SUV that was lurking in the Lenoir City man's neighborhood in the days before he was gunned down on Shaw Ferry Road North in Northern Loudon County.

Jacob Dean Bishop, 35, was shot dead on October 1, just months after returning home from his year-long deployment in Poland. He is pictured with his partner Brittany Kindred (right)

Witnesses described a suspicious white SUV in the neighborhood in the days before the murder and said it was gone the day Bishop was killed. Father-of-two is pictured with Kindred

The vehicle left the area on the day of the murder, Loudon County Sheriff's Office said after working for a week to gather evidence from the scene.

The fiancé of Bishop – a father-of-two – pleaded with the public to help find out who is responsible for taking her Tennessee Army National Guard partner's life.

'If anyone has any information on this vehicle or anything relating to Jay, we BEG you to contact Loudon Co Sheriff's Office. WE WILL NOT GIVE UP,' Brittany Kindred posted on Facebook Tuesday.

His distraught partner shared a video of the pair reuniting in May after his deployment

Kindred has shared emotional Facbeook posts over the past week as police search for his killer

She shared a video of the moment they reunited in May and said the clip was to be played at their forthcoming wedding.

Describing herself as a nurse and 'Urijah & Brayson's Mommy' on her profile, Kindred had the day before attended a graveside service with military honors at the Tennessee Veterans Cemetery.

Bishop's mother Diane has proudly posted images of her Infantryman son on her Facebook profile throughout the years and his own boasts images from his time in Poland.

Bishop was discovered 'unconscious and unresponsive' by his mother Diane (pictured left and right) at his home before 7.43am on October 1

The proud mother shared pictures of her son on her Facebook profile. This one is from July

'We continue to work tirelessly and around the clock to bring the party, or parties, responsible for the murder of a U.S. Soldier to justice, and to provide the Bishop family with some form of closure', said Sheriff Tim Guider. 'Jacob Bishop was a father-of-two, and one of our Nation's guardians.

'We have been pursuing multiple leads, spending countless hours around the clock, in our search for clues that we need to lead us to the party or parties responsible for the tragic killing of another.'

LCSO Authorities believe the murder to be an isolated event and it 'is not thought to be a random killing'.

If anyone has any information regarding the victim, his associates, or the vehicle of interest, they are encouraged to call the Loudon County Sheriff's Office at (865) 986-4823.
description: Jacob Dean Bishop, 35, returned from Poland in May and was discovered 'unconscious and unresponsive' by his mother at his Tennessee home before 7.43am on October 1.
